title: US strikes on Iran did not destroy nuclear sites: Report
byline: An early U.S. intelligence assessment indicated that the U.S. military strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities last week did not destroy the core components of Tehran’s nuclear program and likely only set it back by months, CNN reported on Tuesday, citing three people briefed on it.

title: Showers expected in several areas today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts. Several spells of showers may occur in the North-western province.

title: Dehiwala man arrested for defrauding Rs. 50 mn from 150 individuals by promising foreign jobs
byline: An individual has been arrested in connection with defrauding over Rs. 50 million from around 150 individuals by falsely promising foreign employment opportunities.

title: Gazette issued to convene special Parliament session on Monday
byline: A Gazette Extraordinary has been issued by the Speaker to convene a special session of Parliament on Monday (June 30).

title: Court orders separate investigations into Helicopter crash in Maduru Oya
byline: Court has ordered Sri Lanka Police and the Sri Lanka Air Force to conduct separate investigations into the accident involving a Bell 212 helicopter belonging to the Sri Lanka Air Force, which crashed into the Maduru Oya Reservoir in May.

title: CPC assures no fuel shortage in Sri Lanka
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has assured that there will be no fuel shortage in the country under any circumstances.

title: Bodies of two youth shot and killed found in Middeniya
byline: The bodies of two youth who were shot and killed have been found in Middeniya, police stated.

title: Iran says airspace to remain closed until Wednesday afternoon
byline: An Iranian spokesman said on Tuesday the country’s airspace will remain closed until Wednesday afternoon, according to the semi-official Mehr news agency.

title: 22 students of Southeastern University suspended over ragging incident
byline: The authorities of the Southeastern University have suspended 22 students from academic activities following a ragging incident.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo today for Bohra Conference
byline: A special traffic plan will be in place in several areas of Colombo due to the conduct of the Global Bohra Conference and Spiritual Convention from today (25).

title: UN chief welcomes Trump’s announcement of Israel-Iran ceasefire
byline: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has welcomed U.S. President Donald Trump’s announcement of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, said a UN spokesman.

title: Limited operations at Tel Aviv Airport, Special notice for Sri Lankans hoping to leave for Israel
byline: Several Israeli airlines have resumed a limited number of international flights from the Tel Aviv International Airport, the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Israel, Nimal Bandara has confirmed.

title: Bus strike on 120 Horana-Colombo route
byline: Private bus operators along the Horana-Colombo (120) route have commenced a strike this morning (25), leaving many commuters inconvenienced, stated Ada Derana reporter.

title: 30-year old beaten to death with helmet in Bulathsinhala
byline: A 30-year-old has been beaten to death with a safety helmet in Halwatura, Bulathsinhala, according to police.

title: Iranian-backed hackers go to work after US strikes
byline: Hackers backing Tehran have targeted U.S. banks, defense contractors and oil industry companies following American strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities — but so far have not caused widespread disruptions to critical infrastructure or the economy.

title: Cabinet nod to purchase 200 super-luxury buses for SLTB
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to procure 200 new super-luxury buses for the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), in an effort to modernize the fleet and address the increasing passenger demand, particularly on expressway routes.

title: Iran hangs 3 Israeli men accused for spying
byline: Iran said Wednesday that it executed three men accused of spying for Israel, the day after a truce between the two countries came into effect.

title: Jacqueline Fernandez honoured at Italian Global Series Festival 2025
byline: Bollywood actress Jacqueline Fernandez was honoured at the ongoing Italian Global Series Festival 2025 on Tuesday.

title: Trump nominated for Nobel Peace Prize for ‘extraordinary and historic role’ in Iran-Israel ceasefire deal
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump has reportedly been nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for his “extraordinary and historic role” in brokering a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.

title: ‘Fake news’: Trump rejects intelligence report suggesting US strikes didn’t destroy Iran nuclear sites
byline: US President Donald Trump, on Tuesday (June 24), pushed back against a CNN report which, citing an early US intelligence assessment, suggested that the US military strikes on Iran’s nuclear infrastructure failed to destroy the core components of Tehran’s nuclear programme.

title: Govt to strictly enforce laws preventing children from being used for begging and employment
byline: The government has decided to strictly enforce laws that prohibits children under 16 years old from being used for begging and vending and also to prevent the deployment of children between 16 and 18 years in hazardous employment, such as housemaids, starting from July 1, 2025.

title: Cabinet sub-committee appointed to review challenges posed by Middle East conflict
byline: A Cabinet sub-committees has been appointed to submit appropriate recommendations after closely studying the conflict situation in the Middle East region.

title: Israeli currency strengthens against USD
byline: The Israeli shekel significantly appreciated against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, following the entry into force of the ceasefire between Israel and Iran, according to official exchange rates released by Israel’s central bank.

title: Tourist arrivals in June top 90,000
byline: A total of 93,486 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in June, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: India sends its first astronaut into space in 41 years
byline: Jubilant Indians have been celebrating the successful launch of the Axiom-4 (Ax-4) mission which has taken off with a multi-country crew, including an Indian astronaut.

title: UN Rights Chief meets families of missing persons in Trincomalee
byline: A group of activists and families of missing persons handed over letters and memorandums to the visiting United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk in Trincomalee today (25).

title: Govt proposes 2% bus fare reduction; operators oppose proposal
byline: The government has reportedly proposed a 2% reduction in bus fares in line with the national bus fare policy.

title: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya further remanded
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and subsequently remanded, has been further remanded until July 9, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Independent Group establishes power in Nawalapitiya UC
byline: Amal Priyankara, who contested through an independent group at the recent Local Government (LG) election has been elected as the new Chairman of the Nawalapitiya Urban Council.

title: Arjun Aloysius summoned to Anuradhapura Court
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court has issued an order summoning Arjun Aloysius, the Chairman of the W. M. Mendis and Company, to appear on July 23rd pertaining to an ongoing case, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Bodh Gaya Bodhi tree in excellent health: Indian Scientists
byline: New study conducted by scientists attached to the Forest Research Institute (FRI), Dehradun, India on the sacred Bodhi tree at the Mahabodhi Mahavihara in Bodh Gaya has confirmed “the tree is in excellent health”.

title: Iranian parliament approves bill to suspend cooperation with UN nuclear watchdog
byline: Iran’s parliament approved a bill on Wednesday to suspend cooperation with the U.N. nuclear watchdog, state-affiliated news outlet Nournews reported.

title: NTC approves 2.5% reduction in bus fares
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has approved a 2.5% reduction in bus fares from 01 July 2025.

title: Cabinet repeals decision to transfer Nuwara Eliya Post Office building to UDA
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the resolution to repeal the previous Cabinet decision taken to transfer the Nuwara Eliya Post Office building and its premises to the Urban Development Authority (UDA) and to modify the building and the land to increase tourist attraction and enhance new revenue generation paths.

title: 2025 A/L exam dates announced
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination will be held from November 10 to December 05, 2025, the Department of Examinations confirmed.

title: Container congestion re-emerges at Colombo Port; CTOA demands action
byline: The Chairman of the Container Transport Owners’ Association(CTOA), Sanath Manjula has raised concerns over the re-emergence of container truck congestion at the Colombo Port, attributing the situation to the failure of relevant officials to implement recommendations made by the Cabinet Sub-Committee.

title: Writ against solar payments reduction to be taken up to confirm facts
byline: The Court of Appeal today (25) ordered that a writ petition filed by 17 solar energy producers be taken up on August 04 to confirm the facts.

title: COPE reveals unjust charges against 10 students over hostel damage at J’pura Uni.
byline: During a meeting of the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE), it was revealed that ten students of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura were unjustly charged a monetary penalty in connection with damages caused to a university hostel due to a student clash.

title: Witness testimony of Deshabandu concludes before inquiry committee
byline: The Committee of Inquiry to inquire and report its findings on suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, in respect of acts of gross abuse of power, concluded recording witness testimonies from the respondent Tennakoon’s witness list on Tuesday (24).

title: Several high-ranking prison officers including Superintendents transferred
byline: Two Special Grade Superintendents, a Superintendent, eight Assistant Superintendents and five Acting Superintendents of Prisons have been transferred to other prisons from their current locations, the Department of Prisons said.

title: NATO commits to spending hike sought by Trump, and to mutual defence
byline: NATO leaders on Wednesday backed the big increase in defence spending that U.S. President Donald Trump had demanded, and restated their commitment to defend each other from attack after a brief summit in the Netherlands.

title: Sri Lanka’s Tamil parties urge UN rights chief to ensure accountability
byline: Sri Lanka’s Tamil parties have written a joint letter to visiting UN rights chief Volker Turk, highlighting the need for a sincere and genuine approach to ensure accountability and reconciliation in the island nation.
